channel.title: ALL clients crashing? 64 bit
channel.description:
I'm running 64 bit and ALL clients are having problems, crashing randomly, etc. I try to run in compatibility mode (99% sure that doesn't do anything for a Java client..lol.)
What exactly can I do to fix this problem? Also, some clients I have to compile with an extra parameter, -Xlint[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 02, 2010, 02:30:46 pm[/size][hr]If it helps anyone... [IMG]http://i58.photobucket.com/albums/g255/kiddingdragn12/ScreenShot2File_07.jpg[/img]
Is the error I get.

item.title: ALL clients crashing? 64 bit
item.dc:creator: @Phineas Phineas
item.description:
@Phineas wrote:

Quick answer
Edit the run.bat file
Where it says Java replace it with

"C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe"

Replace only “Java” with this in every run.bat and you can run any client.

Read full topic

item.title: ALL clients crashing? 64 bit
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Don’t use compatibility mode, just use 32bit java. First download it and thencall it from a batch file with C:/Program Files (x86)/ etc etc etc. (same as 64bit version but basically in the “Program Files (x86)” folder.

Read full topic
